author: Cw
text: It’s my first time using stockx. I accidentally purchased the same thing twice because their bid/buy buttons are so similar that I found out through the email confirmation that I had bid on an item when I really wanted to buy it instead. I out put in my payment info thinking I was buying only to find out later it was a bid.so I selected the same product and purchased it right away because it said there was only one left. I figured I’d cancel my bid afterward. But there was no option to cancel and no chat or customer service phone number  anywhere and before I knew it it had shipped! Now I’m getting a duplicate order and no way to contact these people!
title: It’s my first time using stockx

author: Corin
text:
I ordered a pair of Travis Scott Fragment Jordan 1s. They were clearly missdelivered and show on the tracking as delivered in Southampton - several hours away from the address on the order. I have now spent about a month attempting to sort this out with StockX, their live chat seems to only be open half the time it is advertised as open, and majority of my emails have been left unanswered; they have sent me links to verify my identity, after the first few didn't work they told me i needed a guardian to verify as i am under 18, after this ID was submitted they said they couldn't help as the ID doesn't match the order (obviously not as it's a guardians ID). I've been in live chat several times where it just kicks you out, and most recently i was told i was being transferred to a specialist team and they just ended the live chat.

Honestly have never ever had worse service in my entire life. The tracking itself directly shows it was delivered like half the country away from me, and i'm convinced it's some elaborate scam that's preventing them from getting my money back.



EDIT: 
I’m not posting all my order details on a public site, I’ve responded to your email asking for more information with order number, my phone number and email
title: My order never arrived - have now contacted 10+ times and not been helped at all

author: SimpleSimon
text:
Unlike some people on this thread, I actually got my order. All well and good, but returning is another matter.

As I live in the UK, I contacted StockX to invoke the 14-day withdrawal from the contract, so I could send my order back. It's now been 17 days since my initial contact, and despite contacting them 6 times, they haven't done anything to help, except to tell me they're busy. 

***UPDATE*** I know this is a first-world problem, but it's now been 23 days since I initially contacted customer service and 6 days since they reached out for details. Nothing has happened at all - and it's not even the Christmas period.

Truly shocking customer service and won't be using them again.
title: StockX - possibly the worst customer service ever
